word_mean: ［拉］胸腺：位于前上纵隔的淋巴器官，约于青春期发育到最高重量，后即退化。生命早期需有胸腺，细胞免疫功能才能发展成熟。腺体灰红色，最初是两个分开的原基，以后发育为二叶，并以结缔组织相连。胸腺主要由上皮细胞和淋巴细胞(即胸腺细胞)构成，前者主要在髓部，后者主要在皮质，前体细胞进入胸腺，在此分化为淋巴细胞，其中大部分被破坏，其余转移到组织，即成T淋巴细胞。胸腺还分泌一些激素样物质，，如胸腺激素(thymn)、促胸腺生成素(thymopoietin)和胸腺素(thymosin)等

sentence.Network_en: The function of the thymus was unknown until relatively recently.
sentence.Network_cn: 直到不久以前,人们对胸腺的功能尚不明了.

sentence.Network_en: In children under the age of two years the thymus often obscures the upper cardvovascular borders.
sentence.Network_cn: 两岁以下的儿童胸腺常常遮盖上部分心血管边缘.

sentence.Network_en: Conclusion: Polygala fallax Hemsl has effects on increasing avoirdupois of thymus gland.
sentence.Network_cn: 结论: 黄花倒水莲提取物能增加小鼠的体重和胸腺的重量.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting a growth or tumour resembling a bud): from Greek thumos 'excrescence like a thyme bud, thymus gland'

means.word_mean: 1. a ductless glandular organ at the base of the neck that produces lymphocytes and aids in producing immunity; atrophies with age
